alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 20 at 11:20PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM HST TUESDAY FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1117 PM HST, radar indicated rain easing in intensity over windward Haleakala, but gages show water levels remain elevated in windward east Maui streams and rivers. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kipahulu, Nahiku, Hana, Kaupo, Keanae, Haleakala National Park, Hamoa and Wailua. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 1215 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Rainfall and runoff will also cause hazardous driving conditions due to ponding, reduced visibility and poor braking action.
